acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LD50= 5151mg/kg (PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.6), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since the saturated vapor pressure concentration of this product is 11871ppm, it is thought that all inhalation tests were done with vapor. It was classified as Category 3 based on rat LC50 with 4 hour exposure = 1130ppm (PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.6).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on LD50= 710.8mg/kg calculated by rat three data (ACGIH (2001), PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.6).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: Not classified based on UNRTDG Class: 3, though containing unsaturated C-C bonds as chemical groups associated with explosive properties present.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 (GHS standard: flash point being 23 degC or more and 60 degC or less) as flash point being 25 - 31 degC.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There were no in vivo test results and there was no strong positive finding of multiple indices for in vitro test. Therefore we presupposed that we could not categorize it according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the discription although the toxicity to parent animals was unknown, delivery count is decreased (PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.6), it was considered as Category 2. .

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Not classified based on UNRTDG Class: 3, though containing unsaturated C-C bonds as chemical groups associated with self-reactive properties present

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is a statement that there is a severe irritation with a rabbit (PATTY (5th, 2001) vol.6), and redness, a pain and irritation are produced in an eye in humans (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001) vol.6, ICSC (J) (1998)). So it was set as Category 2A based on the above statement.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on descriptions that rabbits had mild or marked skin irritation (PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.6) and that redness, pains and dermatitis on humans are observed (ICSC (J) (1998), HSDB (2005)), it was classified as Category 2.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (systemic toxicity)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 (systemic toxicity) according to that the possibility of giddiness, headache, and respiratory distress are observed in humans (ACGIH (2001)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Respiratory tract irritation, Narcotic effects
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In humans, it is classified into Category 3 (anesthetic actions) based on what central nerve inhibition, such as giddiness, hypesthesia, and headache, is seen (ICSC (J) (1998), HSDB (2005)). Since there was a statement (PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.6, ICSC (J) (1998), HSDB (2005)) of nasal and throat irritation, pharyngeal pain, etc. in humans, it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation).
